Direct Known Subclasses:
DocumentsStepPanel, ReportStepPanel, TaggerStepPanel, TermSelectionStepPanelEVD, TermSelectionStepPanelFrequency, TermSelectionStepPanelHCA, TermSelectionStepPanelTFIDF, TermSelectionStepPanelWSD
public class StepPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel

Simple class that extends JPanel and represents a single step of a multi-step process. File taken from jgaap project

Author:
Chuck Liddell
See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

stepName

public final java.lang.String stepName
Represents the name of the step this panel represents. This name will be displayed in the GUI's step progress indicator, and will also be used to identify to classes implementing StepListener which step is ready for execution. Once set, the stepName cannot be changed.

Constructor Detail

StepPanel

public StepPanel(java.lang.String stepName)
Basic constructor. Creates a new StepPanel with a double buffer and a flow layout.

Parameters:
stepName - the name of the step that this panel represents

StepPanel

public StepPanel(java.lang.String stepName,
                 boolean isDoubleBuffered)
Creates a new StepPanel with FlowLayout and the specified buffering strategy.

Parameters:
stepName - the name of the step that this panel represents
isDoubleBuffered - flag indicating this panel's buffering strategy

StepPanel

public StepPanel(java.lang.String stepName,
                 java.awt.LayoutManager layout)
Create a new buffered StepPanel with the specified layout manager.

Parameters:
stepName - the name of the step that this panel represents
layout - a specific LayoutManager to override the default

StepPanel

public StepPanel(java.lang.String stepName,
                 java.awt.LayoutManager layout,
                 boolean isDoubleBuffered)
Creates a new StepPanel with the specified layout manager and buffering strategy.

Parameters:
stepName - the name of the step that this panel represents
layout - a specific LayoutManager to override the default
isDoubleBuffered - flag indicating this panel's buffering strategy
Method Detail

addStepListener

public void addStepListener(StepListener listener)
Add a StepListener to this panel, which will receive notification of any calls this panel gets to execute.

Parameters:
listener - the StepListener to be added to this step panel.

executeStep

public void executeStep()
Tell this step panel, and any StepListeners it has, to execute.
